summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence from February 2020 among U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) staff regarding travel approval requests for the Epstein investigation (case 2018R01618). It details multiple planned trips from 2019-2020 to conduct victim interviews in Los Angeles, West Palm Beach, Fort Lauderdale, and near Stockholm, Sweden.

persons.name: Darlene Alleyne
persons.context: Recipient and carbon copy on multiple travel approval request emails for the Epstein investigation team.

persons.name: Edward Tyrrell
persons.context: Appears as the approver of travel requests for the Epstein investigation team, responding with 'Approved' from his iPad.

persons.name: Alex
persons.context: Primary author requesting travel approval for the Epstein investigation team to conduct interviews in various locations. Signs off as 'Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York'.

persons.name: Maurene
persons.context: Mentioned as a potential traveler for victim interviews in West Palm Beach and Los Angeles as part of the Epstein investigation team.

persons.name: Alison
persons.context: Mentioned as a potential traveler for victim interviews in West Palm Beach and Los Angeles as part of the Epstein investigation team.

persons.name: Michele Duncan
persons.context: Carbon copy recipient on several travel approval request emails for the Epstein investigation.

connections.description: Alex submits travel approval requests to Edward Tyrrell, who approves them, indicating a supervisor-subordinate or approver-requester relationship within the U.S. Attorney's Office.
Alex copies Darlene Alleyne on travel requests and provides her with FYI updates, indicating a collaborative working relationship on Epstein investigation logistics.
Both are mentioned as members of the investigation team traveling together for victim interviews, indicating他们是同事关系。

events.title: Planned Interview in Los Angeles
events.description: The investigation team plans to conduct at least one interview in Los Angeles, with a conference room requested for this date.

events.title: Planned Interview near Stockholm
events.description: The investigation team requests travel approval for an interview near Stockholm, Sweden, noting an 'added international element'.

events.description: Alex and Maurene plan to travel to West Palm Beach for an interview, requesting a conference room.

events.title: Planned Victim Interview in Los Angeles
events.description: The team plans travel for a 'victim interview' in Los Angeles, involving Alex, Alison, and/or Maurene.

keyFacts: The document references the ongoing federal investigation 'United States v. Epstein, 2018R01618', described as 'an investigation relating to enticement of minors for sexual activity'.

The investigation team was actively conducting victim interviews across multiple domestic and international locations (Los Angeles, West Palm Beach, Fort Lauderdale, and near Stockholm, Sweden) between 2019 and 2020.
Travel requests frequently included approval to reserve hotel conference rooms for conducting interviews.
The correspondence shows a pattern of formal internal approval processes within the U.S. Attorney's Office for investigation-related travel.
An international trip to Sweden in January 2020 is noted as having an 'added international element' compared to prior domestic trips.
